marklogic.body: You overlook the fact that the Supreme Court isn't playing a species favorite in this discussion of the Constitution. Obviously, they consider all creatures to have equal standing, be they rooted in the imagination (corporations) or actual (bacteria). In the case of the latter, a disorganized, profit based health care "system" serves their need to reproduce within human bodies best; with the likelihood of individuals outside or on the fringes of the "system" taking whatever antibiotics they can find. This will allow the bacteria to build up the resistance they need to Gain the universal plague status the Court apparently believes they deserve. Too bad if you aren't a virulent bacillus. But, while you are Coughing up pieces of lung, think about how very constitutional it all is.
